I ordered the brown. The color is like melted milk chocolate. I am 5’8” and wear an XL, 0X or 1X depending on the cut. I can’t button it closed, but the two sides come together and meet and look great as an open blazer. This faux leather isn’t too thick or too shiny like many fakes. It could use a bit more texture, but for $33-$39.00, I won’t complain. I did need to use a steamer to get the folds out, and the lapel collar would not lay flat! The coat came nicely wrapped and packed, but it was folded in a very small box, and I am unable to get the wrinkles out. The label says no dry cleaning, putting in the dryer, or ironing; hand wash only. I actually put paper weights in the pockets while it was on a hanger for a few days. No change. It's sad because i love it but can't wear it out of the house looking the way it does. Haven't decided if I'm keeping it or not.

评论概述: Plays the part of leather jacket really well.. a faux option at a steal of a deal!!
评论详情: Jacket is a solid option.. and fun addition to the wardrobe! It creates a trendy yet, sophisticated business style.. a jacket that seamlessly can transition from office into date night or club attire! Pleasantly surprised how faux leather doesn’t scream plastic!! Jacket has a real moveability and comfortably gets more “broken in” with time similar to real leather. Wearing just x3-4 outings- it has gained a solid ‘go to’ creature comfort.  Folded creases from boxed arrival let go with hanging and acclimated warmth. No off-putting smell noted nor, that dreaded sheen of fake leather. This is a huge perk for just a fraction of the price of real leather- can easily become a closet staple and look the part.  Cut with a slight oversized look.. the online size chart is accurate. Ordering med. for: 23yr old, 5’7”, 130lb, 34B/C.. fit had comfort with enough room to wear over layers or thicker sweater. Sleeve was a bit long.. however, it seems to be part of the style. Note: it is easy to flip over and cuff the extra length if needed. Button front gave enough room to fasten and even “x-stretch scissor” arms across body without restriction (ha.. the move we all do to test for a true fit!) Expect nicely placed working pockets and interior liner to add warmth.. ha! Novel concept a jacket that does its intended job!  Overall, a fashion statement that looks sleek and trendy, while being versatile for a fraction of the cost of leather.. great closet staple! Hoping this info can help- stay safe everyone.

I love this jacket, it kept me warm, it was the perfect fit, and exactly what I was looking for. However, it smelled kinda weird lol. I washed it too and the smell hasn’t fully gone away. Maybe after a few washes but it’s a weird smell

I like that it's lined and the pockets are sufficient. It did have an odor when it was unpacked but after hanging and leaving it to air naturally it was fine. Love this jacket.

My video review goes into more detail but to summarize this jacket is decent for a faux jacket. It's a little sheeny but nothing too dramatic. You can only close it with button at the front so it's more for style than warmth in my opinion.

Oversized is the style now, but I ordered a size smaller so it would be more fitted and I can get more mileage out of it. The seams, lining and attention to detail is amazing. This jacket is buttery soft. So pleased with this jacket. With boots, makes me feel like a million bucks, no matter what is worn between.

This jacket is beautiful. It looks and feels like real leather. It is soft and fits well. I got an XXL, so I. Ours button it, so the sleeves are a little long for me. This can be good for a lot of people.  love this jacket and it will definitely keep me warm.

I normally wear an XL-XXL or 16-18 in US sizes.  This jacket (I ordered a size XL) fit well except for it being slightly snug across the back, but I do have broad shoulders.  Fabric is nice.  Will be a great addition to my wardrobe.  Stylish and sleek. Not for cold weather but great for fall.

Love this coat! It feels like buttery soft leather and it had no smell like most faux leather tends too. The jacket is lined and it fits really nicely with room in the arms too. Buttons are well done and sturdy. It's a beautiful coat and looks and feels like real leather.

评论概述: Nice lightweight blazer-style coat. Takes some work to get the wrinkles out.
评论详情: I almost love this jacket, though a couple of things get in the way of true bliss.  It arrived carefully folded and protected by tissue paper, but being faux leather, it still wrinkled badly. Some wrinkles were so deep I was afraid the fabric was permanently damaged. After doing some online research, I cautiously approached it with a steamer. It took me about 25 minutes and half a gallon of water to make the coat look presentable, heating it with steam and then pressing wrinkles out with my fingers as the fabric cooled. Some fold marks remain, but they aren't too noticeable. The jacket went from looking like cheap plastic to something resembling leather. It's a good fake, not too shiny, but thin.  The jacket is described as a "moto jacket," but it's more of a blazer-style coat. It's boxy and oversized, and despite the princess seams, it drapes rather than skimming the body. Usually, I consider this a good thing because I have some curves to hide around the waist, but I don't like how the thin fabric drapes over my chest, creating several folds. There are also more folds in the sleeves than I like.  The fit is as expected. I ordered my normal size – large – and it was oversized, as advertised. It was a bit snug in the arms but good everywhere else over a bulky sweater, and nicely oversized when worn over a tee. I can button it over a sweater, but I prefer it open. The sleeves are a little too long for me, but that's a consistent problem for me with coats.  The construction is very good. The topstitching is straight and consistent, and the buttonholes are perfect. There's an extra button included, but the ones on the coat are firmly anchored, so I don't think I'll need it. The jacket is fully lined, and there's a gusset in the upper back of the lining. The large front pockets have flaps that can be tucked in cleanly.  There was only the faintest whiff of a chemical smell when I opened the package. I imagine all the steam I used probably helped get rid of any residual odors. It's nice to know that if the coat ever needs washing, it can be hand-laundered in cold water.  I think I'll get some good use out of this jacket in spring and fall, and maybe even in some light rain showers.

I'm 5'9", 125 lbs, got a size small and this surprisingly fit me well. A jacket should have a little room to wear a sweater underneath comfortably. Without a sweater, I have a little extra space in the lower back but it doesn't look oversized. It still looks good. This jacket isn't supposed to hug your curves anyway. The stitch is good and the buttons are a dark color, complementing the jacket. The two pockets are working pockets, as in they're not just for show, the flaps only, nor sewn shut. The jacket, though, arrived very wrinkled due to packaging so I carefully steamed the wrinkles most of the wrinkles out. You can see one is still a bit present on the right side, yet happy with this jacket.

This is a really nice looking jacket! It fits well, and I like that it's a longer length. The leather look fabric is a good weight, and the more formal cut dresses up the overall look. The jacket isn't very heavy, but I can always layer if necessary.

I wear 2x/3x around my hips, and large/1x on top.  This jacket fits like a glove up top. Around my hips I have to leave it open, but it does come around enough so it doesn't look like it's too small. I usually wear my coats and jackets open with a nice light or chunky scarf hanging down in the opening, depending on the wind.  I am impressed with the quality of the pleather, actually looks great. The seems are sewn well. The back looks good. Ample pockets. Standard poly lining. The only con to me is that I have to tack up the sleeves, easy enough... and I have a lot of items I have to do slight tailoring as I am only 5'1" now.  Came well wrapped and just hung it near the wood stove overnight and folding creases came right out. This type of jacket never goes out of style, only the items you wear with it do.  Looks great with a white button up, jeans in blue or black, ankle boots and turquoise or pearl jewelry. Also a black leather shoulder bag. At least that's how I plan to style it.  For the look and the quality, I think the price is good.
Love everything about this jacket! It’s fits great and it’s pretty true to size. The arms are a little long but I have short arms so that’s ok.

this is exactly what I was looking for. it’s a great affordable price especially for the material and how it’s made. this looks so good on and I love the length and it fits me great arm wise as well. it’s literally perfect no complaints!

The look in field of this is definitely high-end. The sizing is accurate. The extra large fits exactly like I hoped it would. So far I’ve paired those with a pair of dark denim jeans and a white bodysuit. The inside lining of the jacket is smooth satin like material. I also love that the leather of the jacket isn’t shiny it’s more MattE.

This is the perfect Blazer/Jacket.  The cut is great.  It absolutely feels and wears on your body like real leather.  It's got a great weight.  Heavy enough to have the look of leather but light enough that it's not too warm or stiff.  You can wear it like an outerwear coat or a blazer with pants or a skirt.  It's very versatile.  I just love it!
